subject: Politics
title: The Fall of the Soviet Union
description: A fast breakdown of The Fall of the Soviet Union for builders.

hook.text: Nobody predicted the Soviet collapse. One of history's most powerful empires vanished without a single shot fired.

buildup.text: By the 1980s, the Soviet economy was stagnant, Afghanistan was a quagmire, and citizens had lost faith.

discovery.text: Gorbachev introduced glasnost (openness) and perestroika (reform). He didn't expect them to destroy the system.

twist.text: Once people could speak freely, they demanded more than reform. The Baltic states declared independence first.

climax.text: In 1991, the USSR dissolved into 15 nations. The Cold War ended. The map of Eurasia was redrawn overnight.

punchline.text: The Soviet Union died of reform. The cure killed the patient.

quiz.question: What were glasnost and perestroika?
options: Gorbachev's policies of openness and economic reform
Military strategies to win the Cold War
Secret police programs to suppress dissent
